Description: A fragment of carved ivory: in the form of a bundle of reeds bound together. One side of the object is convex and is pierced by two holes for attachment, whilst the reverse side is flat. The piece is broken at each end and is partially stained by burning.
Curator's comments: Compare with W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' II' (London, 1954), pl. XXVII. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 27-8, pl.XXXVII, 19.
